Description: The Flight into Egypt; night scene with the Virgin holding the sleeping Christ Child and riding on a donkey, Joseph besides them and peering back anxiously at two patrolling soldiers in the distance at left, an angel holding the reins attached to the donkeys' muzzle and leading, another angel hovering above and holding out a flaming torch to light the way; a proof before all letters; after Peter Paul Rubens Engraving
Producer name: Print made by: Marinus van der Goes
Curator's comments: For the finished impression see R.3.48. This print was issued as a black and white facsimile by the British Museum in 'Reproductions of Prints in the British Museum', New Series Part VII (Specimens of Line-engraving by Masters of the Netherlands Schools Under the Influence of Rubens and Van Dyck (About 1620-1660)), Published by the Trustees in 1898, where it was number VII and described there as 'Marinus Robyn van der Goes. Flight into Egypt: after Rubens.'; see 1899,03.22.62.7 (Shelfmark 245*.b.21).
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (4.I)
Schneevoogt 1873 / Catalogue des estampes gravées d'après P.P.Rubens (24.102)
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Clayton Mordaunt Cracherode (laid down on a mount but with a pencil Cracherode annotation on the back)
